quotes.quote: Every great dream begins with a dreamer. Always remember, you have within you the strength, the patience, and the passion to reach for the stars to change the world.
quotes.author: Harriet Tubman

quotes.quote: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: Judge nothing, you will be happy. Forgive everything, you will be happier. Love everything, you will be happiest.
quotes.author: Sri Chinmoy

quotes.quote: You're never a loser until you quit trying.
quotes.author: Mike Ditka

quotes.quote: But man is not made for defeat. A man can be destroyed but not defeated.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: Where there is love there is life.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.
quotes.author: Demosthenes

quotes.quote: Better than a thousand hollow words, is one word that brings peace.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: I allow my intuition to lead my path.
quotes.author: Manuel Puig

quotes.quote: I think somehow, we learn who we really are and then live with that decision.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: To enjoy life, we must touch much of it lightly.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Whether you think you can or you think you can't, you are right.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.quote: Conditions fall apart. Persist with diligence.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: To free us from the expectations of others, to give us back to ourselves... there lies the great, singular power of self-respect.
quotes.author: Joan Didion

quotes.quote: Whoever doesn't flare up at someone who's angry wins a battle hard to win.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: Great ideas often receive violent opposition from mediocre minds.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Know, first, who you are, and then adorn yourself accordingly.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Whenever something negative happens to you, there is a deep lesson concealed within it.
quotes.author: Eckhart Tolle

quotes.quote: Short words are best and the old words when short are best of all.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.quote: Go for it now. The future is promised to no one.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: I do not know the American gentleman, god forgive me for putting two such words together.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: Pain and foolishness lead to great bliss and complete knowledge, for Eternal Wisdom created nothing under the sun in vain.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: Our intention creates our reality.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: I'm tired of hearing about money, money, money, money, money. I just want to play the game, drink Pepsi, and wear Reebok.
quotes.author: Shaquille O'Neal

quotes.quote: I decided that it was not wisdom that enabled poets to write their poetry, but a kind of instinct or inspiration, such as you find in seers and prophets who deliver all their sublime messages without knowing in the least what they mean.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.quote: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
quotes.author: Francis of Assisi

quotes.quote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
quotes.author: Lucille Ball

quotes.quote: The gambling known as business looks with austere disfavor upon the business known as gambling.
quotes.author: Ambrose Bierce

quotes.quote: If you fell down yesterday, stand up today.
quotes.author: H. G. Wells

quotes.quote: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
quotes.author: Ralph Marston

quotes.quote: Opportunity often comes disguised in the form of misfortune, or temporary defeat.
quotes.author: Napoleon Hill

quotes.quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
quotes.author: Seneca the Younger

quotes.quote: Do you know what my favorite part of the game is? The opportunity to play.
quotes.author: Mike Singletary (basketball)

quotes.quote: The person who makes a success of living is the one who see his goal steadily and aims for it unswervingly. That is dedication.
quotes.author: Cecil B. DeMille

quotes.quote: A hero is no braver than an ordinary man, but he is braver five minutes longer.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day. Teach him how to fish and you feed him for a lifetime.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.quote: Fine words and an insinuating appearance are seldom associated with true virtue
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: If we are not given the chance to forget, we are also not given the chance to recover our memories, to alter them with time, perspective, and wisdom. Forgetting, we can be ourselves beyond what the past has told us we are; we can evolve. That is the possibility we want from the future.
quotes.author: Caterina Fake

quotes.quote: We read the world wrong and say that it deceives us.
quotes.author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.quote: Beware of missing chances; otherwise it may be altogether too late someday.
quotes.author: Franz Liszt

quotes.quote: Nothing strengthens authority so much as silence.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.quote: He who angers you conquers you.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Kenny

quotes.quote: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
quotes.author: Frank Abagnale

quotes.quote: They say that time changes things, but you actually have to change them yourself.
quotes.author: Andy Warhol

quotes.quote: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
quotes.author: William Burroughs

quotes.quote: Real magic in relationships means an absence of judgement of others.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: When an opponent comes forward, move in and greet him; if he wants to pull back, send him on his way.
quotes.author: Morihei Ueshiba

quotes.quote: We the people are the rightful masters of both Congress and the courts, not to overthrow the Constitution but to overthrow the men who pervert the Constitution.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: The best way out is always through.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: There is no retirement for an artist, it's your way of living so there is no end to it.
quotes.author: Henry Moore

quotes.quote: Our work is the presentation of our capabilities.
quotes.author: Edward Gibbon

quotes.quote: Chaos and Order are not enemies, only opposites.
quotes.author: Richard Garriott

quotes.quote: When the world is so complicated, the simple gift of friendship is within all of our hands.
quotes.author: Maria Shriver

quotes.quote: I will prepare and some day my chance will come.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: What sweetness is left in life, if you take away friendship? Robbing life of friendship is like robbing the world of the sun. A true friend is more to be esteemed than kinsfolk.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: You don't play against opponents, you play against the game of basketball.
quotes.author: Bob Knight

quotes.quote: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.
quotes.author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quotes.quote: Well begun is half done.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

quotes.quote: Whatever happens, take responsibility.
quotes.author: Tony Robbins

quotes.quote: Hope arouses, as nothing else can arouse, a passion for the possible.
quotes.author: William Sloane Coffin

quotes.quote: To be wronged is nothing unless you continue to remember it.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Our kindness may be the most persuasive argument for that which we believe.
quotes.author: Gordon Hinckley

quotes.quote: If you have made mistakes, there is always another chance for you. You may have a fresh start any moment you choose.
quotes.author: Mary Pickford

quotes.quote: Nature and books belong to the eyes that see them.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: All difficult things have their origin in that which is easy, and great things in that which is small.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.quote: A mind unruffled by the vagaries of fortune, from sorrow freed, from defilements cleansed, from fear liberated — this is the greatest blessing.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: Technology… is a queer thing. It brings you great gifts with one hand, and it stabs you in the back with the other.
quotes.author: Carrie Snow

quotes.quote: Being entirely honest with oneself is a good exercise.
quotes.author: Sigmund Freud

quotes.quote: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
quotes.author: Walt Disney

quotes.quote: It is common sense to take a method and try it. If it fails, admit it frankly and try another. But above all, try something.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: There is only one happiness in life, to love and be loved.
quotes.author: George Sand

quotes.quote: The fewer rules a coach has, the fewer rules there are for players to break.
quotes.author: John Madden

quotes.quote: The less effort, the faster and more powerful you will be.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.quote: Things do not change; we change.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: How we spend our days is, of course, how we spend our lives.
quotes.author: Annie Dillard

quotes.quote: I will love the light for it shows me the way, yet I will endure the darkness because it shows me the stars.
quotes.author: Og Mandino

quotes.quote: A fine quotation is a diamond on the finger of a man of wit, and a pebble in the hand of a fool.
quotes.author: Joseph Roux

quotes.quote: It is one of the severest tests of friendship to tell your friend his faults. So to love a man that you cannot bear to see a stain upon him, and to speak painful truth through loving words, that is friendship.
quotes.author: Henry Ward Beecher

quotes.quote: Technology has to be invented or adopted.
quotes.author: Jared Diamond

quotes.quote: The biggest adventure you can ever take is to live the life of your dreams.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best.
quotes.author: Marilyn Monroe

quotes.quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any other.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: People take different roads seeking fulfilment and happiness. Just because they're not on your road doesn't mean they've gotten lost.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: Technology made large populations possible; large populations now make technology indispensable.
quotes.author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quotes.quote: Meditation brings wisdom, lack of meditation leaves ignorance. Know well what leads you forward and what holds you back and choose the path that leads to wisdom.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: All our talents increase in the using, and every faculty, both good and bad, strengthen by exercise.
quotes.author: Anne Brontë

quotes.quote: Democracy's premise rests on the notion that the collective wisdom of the majority will prove right more often than it's wrong; that given sufficient opportunity in the pursuit of happiness, your population will develop its talents, its intellect, its better judgment; that over time its capacity for discernment and self-correction will be enlarged.
quotes.author: Ben Fountain

quotes.quote: Without freedom of thought, there can be no such thing as wisdom - and no such thing as public liberty without freedom of speech.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: When we feel love and kindness toward others, it not only makes others feel loved and cared for, but it helps us also to develop inner happiness and peace.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: Be faithful in small things because it is in them that your strength lies.
quotes.author: Mother Teresa

quotes.quote: There are two primary choices in life: to accept conditions as they exist or accept responsibility for changing them.
quotes.author: Denis Waitley

quotes.quote: Action is the foundational key to all success.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: Knowledge has three degrees: opinion, science, illumination. The means or instrument of the first is sense; of the second, dialectic; of the third, intuition.
quotes.author: Plotinus

quotes.quote: Wisdom consists of the anticipation of consequences.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.quote: You can tell whether a man is clever by his answers. You can tell whether a man is wise by his questions.
quotes.author: Naguib Mahfouz

quotes.quote: The free man is he who does not fear to go to the end of his thought.
quotes.author: Léon Blum

quotes.quote: Let us resolve to be masters, not the victims, of our history, controlling our own destiny without giving way to blind suspicions and emotions.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.quote: Life is so constructed that an event does not, cannot, will not, match the expectation.
quotes.author: Charlotte Brontë

quotes.quote: All our knowledge begins with the senses, proceeds then to the understanding, and ends with reason. There is nothing higher than reason.
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

quotes.quote: Don't believe what your eyes are telling you. All they show is limitation. Look with your understanding, find out what you already know, and you'll see the way to fly.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.quote: Wisdom and penetration are the fruit of experience, not the lessons of retirement and leisure. Great necessities call out great virtues.
quotes.author: Abigail Adams

quotes.quote: If a man does not make new acquaintances as he advances through life, he will soon find himself left alone. A man, sir, should keep his friendship in a constant repair.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: But the attitude of faith is to let go, and become open to truth, whatever it might turn out to be.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.quote: The final proof of greatness lies in being able to endure criticism without resentment.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Cunning... is but the low mimic of wisdom.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Ignorant men don't know what good they hold in their hands until they've flung it away.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.quote: Never explain - your friends do not need it and your enemies will not believe you anyway.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Our passion is our strength.
quotes.author: Billie Armstrong

quotes.quote: Use what talents you possess; the woods would be very silent if no birds sang there except those that sang best.
quotes.author: Henry van Dyke Jr.

quotes.quote: You cannot change anything in your life with intention alone, which can become a watered-down, occasional hope that you'll get to tomorrow. Intention without action is useless.
quotes.author: Caroline Myss

quotes.quote: The noblest worship is to make yourself as good and as just as you can.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.quote: Technology is the campfire around which we tell our stories.
quotes.author: Laurie Anderson

quotes.quote: Do not scorn what you have received, nor envy the gains of others. He who envies others does not obtain peace of mind.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: You can't put a limit on anything. The more you dream, the farther you get.
quotes.author: Michael Phelps

quotes.quote: It seemed the world was divided into good and bad people. The good ones slept better... while the bad ones seemed to enjoy the waking hours much more.
quotes.author: Woody Allen

quotes.quote: I am not the first Buddha who came upon Earth, nor shall I be the last. In due time, another Buddha will arise in the world - a Holy One, a supremely enlightened One, endowed with wisdom in conduct, auspicious, knowing the universe, an incomparable leader of men, a master of angels and mortals.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: One's friends are that part of the human race with which one can be human.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: Doing nothing is better than being busy doing nothing.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.quote: Some people are born on third base and go through life thinking they hit a triple.
quotes.author: Barry Switzer

quotes.quote: Trying to sneak a fastball past Hank Aaron is like trying to sneak the sunrise past a rooster.
quotes.author: Joe Adcock

quotes.quote: The young man knows the rules, but the old man knows the exceptions.
quotes.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes Jr.

quotes.quote: No one has a finer command of language than the person who keeps his mouth shut.
quotes.author: Sam Rayburn

quotes.quote: Nothing but heaven itself is better than a friend who is really a friend.
quotes.author: Plautus

quotes.quote: Instead of saying that man is the creature of circumstance, it would be nearer the mark to say that man is the architect of circumstance.
quotes.author: Thomas Carlyle

quotes.quote: A day of worry is more exhausting than a day of work.
quotes.author: John Lubbock

quotes.quote: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: When we seek to discover the best in others, we somehow bring out the best in ourselves.
quotes.author: William Arthur Ward

quotes.quote: A true friend freely, advises justly, assists readily, adventures boldly, takes all patiently, defends courageously, and continues a friend unchangeably.
quotes.author: William C. Menninger

quotes.quote: Where is the Life we have lost in living? Where is the wisdom we have lost in knowledge? Where is the knowledge we have lost in information?
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: Happiness does not come about only due to external circumstances; it mainly derives from inner attitudes.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: I hope our wisdom will grow with our power, and teach us, that the less we use our power the greater it will be.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: I never teach my pupils. I only attempt to provide the conditions in which they can learn.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Good actions give strength to ourselves and inspire good actions in others.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: Those who are blessed with the most talent don't necessarily outperform everyone else. It's the people with follow-through who excel.
quotes.author: Mary Kay Ash

quotes.quote: You can't blame gravity for falling in love.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: There are no failures. Just experiences and your reactions to them.
quotes.author: Tom Krause

quotes.quote: There is some self-interest behind every friendship. There is no friendship without self-interests. This is a bitter truth.
quotes.author: Chanakya

quotes.quote: Some people thrive on huge, dramatic change. Some people prefer the slow and steady route. Do what's right for you.
quotes.author: Julie Morgenstern

quotes.quote: Genuine love should first be directed at oneself; if we do not love ourselves, how can we love others?
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: If the stars should appear but one night every thousand years how man would marvel and adore.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The world is but a canvas to the imagination.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: It is one of the blessings of old friends that you can afford to be stupid with them.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: So long as a person is capable of self-renewal they are a living being.
quotes.author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel

quotes.quote: A lot of people give up just before theyre about to make it. You know you never know when that next obstacle is going to be the last one.
quotes.author: Chuck Norris

quotes.quote: All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.quote: If you don't know where you are going, any road will get you there.
quotes.author: Lewis Carroll

quotes.quote: A dream is your creative vision for your life in the future. You must break out of your current comfort zone and become comfortable with the unfamiliar and the unknown.
quotes.author: Denis Waitley

quotes.quote: America's freedom of religion, and freedom from religion, offers every wisdom tradition an opportunity to address our soul-deep needs: Christianity, Judaism, Islam, Buddhism, Hinduism, secular humanism, agnosticism and atheism among others.
quotes.author: Parker Palmer

quotes.quote: All is flux; nothing stays still.
quotes.author: Heraclitus

quotes.quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: You have to do your own growing no matter how tall your grandfather was.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Those who will play with cats must expect to be scratched.
quotes.author: Miguel de Cervantes

quotes.quote: Almost everything comes from nothing.
quotes.author: Henri-Frédéric Amiel

quotes.quote: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
quotes.author: Ayn Rand

quotes.quote: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Each man has his own vocation; his talent is his call. There is one direction in which all space is open to him.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I don't believe in failure. It's not failure if you enjoyed the process.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude.
quotes.author: Ralph Marston

quotes.quote: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.quote: The entrepreneur always searches for change, responds to it, and exploits it as an opportunity.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
quotes.author: Cicero

quotes.quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: The ultimate promise of technology is to make us master of a world that we command by the push of a button.
quotes.author: Volker Grassmuck

quotes.quote: By letting it go it all gets done. The world is won by those who let it go. But when you try and try. The world is beyond the winning.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.quote: Gratitude makes sense of our past, brings peace for today, and creates a vision for tomorrow.
quotes.author: Melody Beattie

quotes.quote: As we are liberated from our own fear, our presence automatically liberates others.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens.
quotes.author: Jimi Hendrix

quotes.quote: Happiness mainly comes from our own attitude, rather than from external factors.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: Let there be no purpose in friendship save the deepening of the spirit.
quotes.author: Kahlil Gibran

quotes.quote: To do all that one is able to do, is to be a man; to do all that one would like to do, is to be a god.
quotes.author: Napoleon

quotes.quote: The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.
quotes.author: Alfred Tennyson

quotes.quote: Decision is a risk rooted in the courage of being free.
quotes.author: Paul Tillich

quotes.quote: Whoever is happy will make others happy, too.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: When you dance, your purpose is not to get to a certain place on the floor. It's to enjoy each step along the way.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: Never mistake motion for action.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: Take up one idea. Make that one idea your life - think of it, dream of it, live on that idea. Let the brain, muscles, nerves, every part of your body, be full of that idea, and just leave every other idea alone. This is the way to success.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.quote: Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
quotes.author: Montesquieu

quotes.quote: Take rest; a field that has rested gives a bountiful crop.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: When I was 40, my doctor advised me that a man in his 40s shouldn't play tennis. I heeded his advice carefully and could hardly wait until I reached 50 to start again.
quotes.author: Hugo Black

quotes.quote: God gave us the gift of life; it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Well done is better than well said.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: He that respects himself is safe from others; he wears a coat of mail that none can pierce.
quotes.author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quotes.quote: Does wisdom perhaps appear on the earth as a raven which is inspired by the smell of carrion?
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: No one has ever become poor by giving.
quotes.author: Anne Frank

quotes.quote: Those who cling to perceptions and views wander the world offending people.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: Make the most of yourself, for that is all there is of you.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: It is the neglect of timely repair that makes rebuilding necessary.
quotes.author: Richard Whately

quotes.quote: Don't be dismayed by good-byes. A farewell is necessary before you can meet again. And meeting again, after moments or lifetimes, is certain for those who are friends.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.quote: Take no thought of who is right or wrong or who is better than. Be not for or against.
quotes.author: Bruce Lee

quotes.quote: There is only one success: to be able to spend your life in your own way.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.quote: I am not bothered by the fact that I am unknown. I am bothered when I do not know others.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Whatever we expect with confidence becomes our own self-fulfilling prophecy.
quotes.author: Brian Tracy

quotes.quote: Beginning today, treat everyone you meet as if they were going to be dead by midnight. Extend to them all the care, kindness and understanding you can muster, and do it with no thought of any reward. Your life will never be the same again.
quotes.author: Og Mandino

quotes.quote: When I do good I feel good, when I do bad I feel bad, and that's my religion.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: Imagination is the highest kite one can fly.
quotes.author: Lauren Bacall

quotes.quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: A failure is a man who has blundered but is not capable of cashing in on the experience.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: It is not wisdom but Authority that makes a law.
quotes.author: Thomas Hobbes

quotes.quote: There is only one success - to be able to spend your life in your own way.
quotes.author: Christopher Morley

quotes.quote: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
quotes.author: Leo Tolstoy

quotes.quote: I am always doing that which I cannot do, in order that I may learn how to do it.
quotes.author: Pablo Picasso

quotes.quote: What wisdom can you find that is greater than kindness?
quotes.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quotes.quote: To be aware of a single shortcoming in oneself is more useful than to be aware of a thousand in someone else.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: Know from the rivers in clefts and in crevices: those in small channels flow noisily, the great flow silent. Whatever's not full makes noise. Whatever is full is quiet.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.quote: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: To conquer fear is the beginning of wisdom.
quotes.author: Bertrand Russell

quotes.quote: Set your goals high, and don't stop till you get there.
quotes.author: Bo Jackson

quotes.quote: The essence of true friendship is to make allowance for another's little lapses.
quotes.author: Ovid

quotes.quote: The truest wisdom is a resolute determination.
quotes.author: Napoleon

quotes.quote: To follow, without halt, one aim: There is the secret of success.
quotes.author: Anna Pavlova

quotes.quote: True wisdom comes to each of us when we realize how little we understand about life, ourselves, and the world around us.
quotes.author: Isocrates

quotes.quote: Wisdom has its root in goodness, not goodness its root in wisdom.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: True happiness means forging a strong spirit that is undefeated, no matter how trying our circumstances.
quotes.author: Daisaku Ikeda

quotes.quote: We can only learn to love by loving.
quotes.author: Iris Murdoch

quotes.quote: There are people who have money and people who are rich.
quotes.author: Coco Chanel

quotes.quote: Just as a solid rock is not shaken by the storm, even so the wise are not affected by praise or blame.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: I am building a fire, and everyday I train, I add more fuel. At just the right moment, I light the match.
quotes.author: Mia Hamm

quotes.quote: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: By going beyond your own problems and taking care of others, you gain inner strength, self-confidence, courage, and a greater sense of calm.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: Myths which are believed in tend to become true.
quotes.author: George Orwell

quotes.quote: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Begin, be bold, and venture to be wise.
quotes.author: Horace

quotes.quote: If I had only known, I would have been a locksmith.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: Where there is great love, there are always miracles.
quotes.author: Willa Cather

quotes.quote: When you judge another, you do not define them, you define yourself.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: Until you value yourself, you won't value your time. Until you value your time, you won't do anything with it.
quotes.author: M. Scott Peck

quotes.quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
quotes.author: Seneca the Younger

quotes.quote: Every man is a damn fool for at least five minutes every day; wisdom consists in not exceeding the limit.
quotes.author: Elbert Hubbard

quotes.quote: Meditate … do not delay, lest you later regret it.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: Remember that the most valuable antiques are dear old friends.
quotes.author: H. Jackson Brown Jr.

quotes.quote: Yesterday's home runs don't win today's games.
quotes.author: Babe Ruth

quotes.quote: One must be fond of people and trust them if one is not to make a mess of life.
quotes.author: E. M. Forster

quotes.quote: There are three faithful friends - an old wife, an old dog, and ready money.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Tragedy is a tool for the living to gain wisdom, not a guide by which to live.
quotes.author: Robert F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Prejudice is a burden that confuses the past, threatens the future and renders the present inaccessible.
quotes.author: Maya Angelou

quotes.quote: Anything you really want, you can attain, if you really go after it.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: Always be smarter than the people who hire you.
quotes.author: Lena Horne

quotes.quote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Treat people as if they were what they ought to be, and you help them to become what they are capable of being.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Strong people make as many mistakes as weak people. Difference is that strong people admit their mistakes, laugh at them, learn from them. That is how they become strong.
quotes.author: Richard Needham

quotes.quote: To lead people walk behind them.
quotes.author: Laozi

quotes.quote: Sustaining true friendship is a lot more challenging than we give it credit for.
quotes.author: Mariella Frostrup

quotes.quote: You are the only person on earth who can use your ability.
quotes.author: Zig Ziglar

quotes.quote: It is unwise to be too sure of one's own wisdom. It is healthy to be reminded that the strongest might weaken and the wisest might err.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: There are no strangers here; Only friends you haven't yet met.
quotes.author: William Butler Yeats

quotes.quote: It had long since come to my attention that people of accomplishment rarely sat back and let things happen to them. They went out and happened to things.
quotes.author: Leonardo da Vinci

quotes.quote: Subdue your appetites, my dears, and you've conquered human nature.
quotes.author: Charles Dickens

quotes.quote: Let my skin and sinews and bones dry up, together with all the flesh and blood of my body! I welcome it! But I will not move from this spot until I have attained the supreme and final wisdom.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: Let yourself be silently drawn by the stronger pull of what you really love.
quotes.author: Rumi

quotes.quote: The time to repair the roof is when the sun is shining.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Things do not happen. Things are made to happen.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: Our greatness lies not so much in being able to remake the world as being able to remake ourselves.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: Without hard work, nothing grows but weeds.
quotes.author: Gordon Hinckley

quotes.quote: Let none find fault with others; let none see the omissions and commissions of others. But let one see one's own acts, done and undone.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: Music is a higher revelation than all wisdom and philosophy.
quotes.author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quotes.quote: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams, who looks inside, awakes.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote: If you only have a hammer, you tend to see every problem as a nail.
quotes.author: Abraham Maslow

quotes.quote: Things turn out best for those who make the best of the way things turn out.
quotes.author: Jack Buck

quotes.quote: Don't worry about people stealing your ideas. If your ideas are any good, you'll have to ram them down people's throats.
quotes.author: Howard H. Aiken

quotes.quote: Finding good players is easy. Getting them to play as a team is another story.
quotes.author: Casey Stengel

quotes.quote: If there is such a thing as a good marriage, it is because it resembles friendship rather than love.
quotes.author: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.quote: Mistakes are the usual bridge between inexperience and wisdom.
quotes.author: Phyllis Grissim-Theroux

quotes.quote: Trouble is only opportunity in work clothes.
quotes.author: Henry J. Kaiser

quotes.quote: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils; for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: He who has imagination without learning has wings but no feet.
quotes.author: Joseph Joubert

quotes.quote: We can change our lives. We can do, have, and be exactly what we wish.
quotes.author: Tony Robbins

quotes.quote: Never deny a diagnosis but do deny the negative verdict that may go with it.
quotes.author: Norman Cousins

quotes.quote: You were not born a winner, and you were not born a loser. You are what you make yourself be.
quotes.author: Lou Holtz

quotes.quote: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly, what is essential is invisible to the eye.
quotes.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quotes.quote: People ask me what I do in winter when there's no baseball. I'll tell you what I do. I stare out the window and wait for spring.
quotes.author: Rogers Hornsby

quotes.quote: I gave my life to become the person I am right now. Was it worth it?
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.quote: Golf is a game in which one endeavors to control a ball with implements ill adapted for the purpose.
quotes.author: Woodrow Wilson

quotes.quote: Much wisdom often goes with fewest words.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.quote: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
quotes.author: Samuel Johnson

quotes.quote: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other?
quotes.author: George Eliot

quotes.quote: Mediocrity knows nothing higher than itself, but talent instantly recognizes genius.
quotes.author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quotes.quote: Of all possessions a friend is the most precious.
quotes.author: Herodotus

quotes.quote: The greatest danger for most of us is not that our aim is too high, and we miss it, but that it is too low, and we reach it.
quotes.author: Michelangelo

quotes.quote: If one does not know to which port is sailing, no wind is favorable.
quotes.author: Seneca the Younger

quotes.quote: Only I can change my life. No one can do it for me.
quotes.author: Carol Burnett

quotes.quote: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: Argue for your limitations, and sure enough they're yours.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.quote: One friend in a lifetime is much; two are many; three are hardly possible. Friendship needs a certain parallelism of life, a community of thought, a rivalry of aim.
quotes.author: Brooks Adams

quotes.quote: To fly as fast as thought, you must begin by knowing that you have already arrived.
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.quote: It's better to be a lion for a day than a sheep all your life.
quotes.author: Elizabeth Kenny

quotes.quote: Can miles truly separate you from friends... If you want to be with someone you love, aren't you already there?
quotes.author: Richard Bach

quotes.quote: Do one thing every day that scares you.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Follow effective action with quiet reflection. From the quiet reflection will come even more effective action.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: Miracles come in moments. Be ready and willing.
quotes.author: Wayne Dyer

quotes.quote: Things are as they are. Looking out into it the universe at night, we make no comparisons between right and wrong stars, nor between well and badly arranged constellations.
quotes.author: Alan Watts

quotes.quote: Men of perverse opinion do not know the excellence of what is in their hands, till someone dash it from them.
quotes.author: Sophocles

quotes.quote: I violated the Noah rule: Predicting rain doesn't count; building arks does.
quotes.author: Warren Buffett

quotes.quote: People are not lazy. They simply have impotent goals - that is, goals that do not inspire them.
quotes.author: Tony Robbins

quotes.quote: I would maintain that thanks are the highest form of thought, and that gratitude is happiness doubled by wonder.
quotes.author: G. K. Chesterton

quotes.quote: It is not the possession of truth, but the success which attends the seeking after it, that enriches the seeker and brings happiness to him.
quotes.author: Max Planck

quotes.quote: I prefer to be true to myself, even at the hazard of incurring the ridicule of others, rather than to be false, and to incur my own abhorrence.
quotes.author: Frederick Douglass

quotes.quote: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
quotes.author: William James

quotes.quote: Along with success comes a reputation for wisdom.
quotes.author: Euripides

quotes.quote: 'As I am, so are these. As are these, so am I.' Drawing the parallel to yourself, neither kill nor get others to kill.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The moment one gives close attention to anything, even a blade of grass, it becomes a mysterious, awesome, indescribably magnificent world in itself.
quotes.author: Henry Miller

quotes.quote: Belief consists in accepting the affirmations of the soul; Unbelief, in denying them.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Better to have loved and lost, than to have never loved at all.
quotes.author: Augustine of Hippo

quotes.quote: It takes courage to grow up and become who you really are.
quotes.author: E. E. Cummings

quotes.quote: Wise men talk because they have something to say; fools, because they have to say something.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: I never think of the future. It comes soon enough.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The trick is in what one emphasizes. We either make ourselves miserable, or we make ourselves happy. The amount of work is the same.
quotes.author: Carlos Castaneda

quotes.quote: No garden is without its weeds.
quotes.author: Thomas Fuller

quotes.quote: The beginning of wisdom is found in doubting; by doubting we come to the question, and by seeking we may come upon the truth.
quotes.author: Peter Abelard

quotes.quote: Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have.
quotes.author: Doris Mortman

quotes.quote: Through pride we are ever deceiving ourselves. But deep down below the surface of the average conscience a still, small voice says to us, something is out of tune.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote: When in doubt, tell the truth.
quotes.author: Mark Twain

quotes.quote: Get busy living or get busy dying.
quotes.author: Stephen King

quotes.quote: In the end we retain from our studies only that which we practically apply.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Everything comes to him who hustles while he waits.
quotes.author: Thomas Edison

quotes.quote: Just as a flower, which seems beautiful has color but no perfume, so are the fruitless words of a man who speaks them but does them not.
quotes.author: Dhammapada

quotes.quote: Before we acquire great power, we must acquire wisdom to use it well.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: Begin at once to live and count each separate day as a separate life.
quotes.author: Seneca the Younger

quotes.quote: Always bear in mind that your own resolution to succeed is more important than any one thing.
quotes.author: Abraham Lincoln

quotes.quote: I hear and I forget. I see and I remember. I do and I understand.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. ‘Til your good is better and your better is best.
quotes.author: Jerome

quotes.quote: A man sees in the world what he carries in his heart.
quotes.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quotes.quote: Those that know, do. Those that understand, teach.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.
quotes.author: Leo Buscaglia

quotes.quote: He who lives in harmony with himself lives in harmony with the world.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius

quotes.quote: Friends are those rare people who ask how we are and then wait to hear the answer.
quotes.author: Ed Cunningham

quotes.quote: Who looks outside, dreams, who looks inside, awakes.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote: The world turns aside to let any man pass who knows where he is going.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: Discipline is the bridge between goals and accomplishment.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.quote: Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.
quotes.author: Oprah Winfrey

quotes.quote: The greatest obstacle to being heroic is the doubt whether one may not be going to prove oneself a fool; the truest heroism is to resist the doubt; and the profoundest wisdom, to know when it ought to be resisted, and when it be obeyed.
quotes.author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quotes.quote: Remember always that you not only have the right to be an individual, you have an obligation to be one.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Meditation is the dissolution of thoughts in eternal awareness or Pure consciousness without objectification, knowing without thinking, merging finitude in infinity.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: Where there is charity and wisdom, there is neither fear nor ignorance.
quotes.author: Francis of Assisi

quotes.quote: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you can see.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see.
quotes.author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.quote: Resolutely train yourself to attain peace.
quotes.author: The Buddha

quotes.quote: Ideas pull the trigger, but instinct loads the gun.
quotes.author: Don Marquis

quotes.quote: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
quotes.author: Thomas Jefferson

quotes.quote: Experience keeps a dear school, but fools will learn in no other.
quotes.author: Benjamin Franklin

quotes.quote: Spectacular achievement is always preceded by unspectacular preparation.
quotes.author: Robert Schuller

quotes.quote: Give whatever you are doing and whoever you are with the gift of your attention.
quotes.author: Jim Rohn

quotes.quote: Those who cannot learn from history are doomed to repeat it.
quotes.author: George Santayana

quotes.quote: We never live; we are always in the expectation of living.
quotes.author: Voltaire

quotes.quote: It's important to know that words don't move mountains. Work, exacting work moves mountains.
quotes.author: Danilo Dolci

quotes.quote: Not all those who wander are lost.
quotes.author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
quotes.author: Epictetus

quotes.quote: The aim of life is self-development. To realize one's nature perfectly - that is what each of us is here for.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: Friendship often ends in love, but love in friendship - never.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: Everything we hear is an opinion, not a fact. Everything we see is a perspective, not the truth.
quotes.author: Marcus Aurelius
